wikipedia_page.main: Karin Marguerite Smyth (born 8 September 1964) is a British Labour Party politician. She was elected as the Member of Parliament (MP) for Bristol South in 2015.

response: *Karin Smyth, Labour MP for Bristol South

Alumni in UK politics include the Labour Members of Parliament Rachael Maskell (Physiotherapy, 1994), and Karin Smyth (Politics, 1988); two former Leaders of the House of Lords, Valerie Amos, Baroness Amos (Applied Research in Education, 1978),‘AMOS’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and Thomas Galbraith, 2nd Baron Strathclyde (Modern Languages & European Studies, 1982);‘STRATHCLYDE’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and the Liberal Democrat peer Rosalind Scott, Baroness Scott of Needham Market (European Studies, 1999).‘SCOTT OF NEEDHAM MARKET’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 UEA is also the alma mater of the former Crossbench peer Timothy Bentinck, 12th Earl of Portland (History of Art, 1975); and the former Members of Parliament Caroline Flint (American Literature, History & Film, 1983),‘FLINT, Rt Hon. Caroline Louise’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Douglas Carswell (History, 1993), Tony Colman (International Development), Jon Owen Jones (Ecology, 1975), Tess Kingham (Education), Judith Chaplin and Ivor Stanbrook (Law, 1995).
Southville forms a part of the Bristol South parliamentary constituency, currently represented by Karin Smyth.
Bedminster is part of the Bristol South constituency, whose MP is Karin Smyth of the Labour Party since 2015.

Since 2015, the two Bristol City councillors for Filwood ward have been Labour Party members. The MP for the Bristol South constituency, since 2015, is Karin Smyth, of the Labour Party.Karin Smyth, MP. Prior to that, the constituency was represented from 1987 by Dawn Primarolo, now the Right Honourable the Baroness Primarolo.Baroness Primarolo Prior to Brexit in 2020, Filwood was represented in the European Parliament by the six MEPs of the South West England constituency.
Bristol South is a constituency represented in the House of Commons of the UK Parliament since 2015 by Karin Smyth of the Labour Party.

response: Karin Smyth announced her intention to step down as Shadow Northern Ireland Minister on 26 February to focus on constituency work and other issues, and was replaced by PPS Alex Davies-Jones. Emma Hardy resigned as Shadow FE and Universities Minister for similar reasons on 8 March, and was succeeded by Opposition Whip Matt Western.

Keir Starmer reappointed her to the frontbench after winning the 2020 Labour leadership election. After the November 2021 shadow cabinet reshuffle, it was announced that Karin Smyth will cover her duties while Kendall is on maternity leave.

The All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Ireland was founded in the late 1990s in the context of the Northern Ireland peace process by parliamentarians with an interest in Irish affairs. Since its establishment, the APPG has worked closely with Irish in Britain. The APPG's current chair is Labour MP Conor McGinn, who represents St Helens North and is originally from County Armagh. The Vice-Chairs are Mark Logan (Conservative), Martin Docherty-Hughes (SNP), Baroness Harris of Richmond (Liberal Democrat) and Karin Smyth (Labour). Former chairs include Ruane and Kevin McNamara.
